bibl.title: Textiles and Architecture in the Graeco-Roman and Byzantine Egypt.
bibl.note: 1. The ancient vocabulary: 1.1. Terms having multiple meanings; - 1.2. Meaning changing over time. - 2. Two test cases: 2.1. Purchase and manufacturing of luxury beddings in the Zenon archive; - 2.2. Church and monastic inventories. - 3. Conclusion.

bibl.title: assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007.
